reviewText: This documentary helps to show how Earp's reputation was sanitized in 20th century media. Currently the Encore cable network's Westerns channel is airing the Wyatt Earp series starring Hugh O'Brian. Arthur Conan Doyle once wrote that real life is infinitely stranger than anything fiction can invent. Watching the "American Experience" treatment of Earp is a textbook example of Doyle's conclusion.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Interesting look at Wyatt Earp,I have to follow up on this and read or look for a good book on the subject. He seems interesting to me, A figure of Law and Order(with a few exceptions) but nonetheless one who got rid of bad elements and who never quite fit in,I am not sure how accurate considering it's Pbs and it's usual slant in some matters. I like the fact the Wyatt did not impede Good Progress(Railroads,Mines,etc) instead of the thuggery and anarchy.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Been lots of TV shows about Wyatt Earp and the real reasons for the gunfight at the OK. This PBS DVD gives you the real scoop on Wyatt and his brothers, and the true background on the gunfight at the (behind) the OK. You'll be surprised. If you are a history buff, this belongs in your DVD collection!Wyatt Earp
summary: The Real Deal on Wyatt Earp & the Infamous Gunfight
